./: superframe前端极速浏览框架，是一种前端异步单页技术。
以此来减少用户等待时间，以及提高页面渲染速度。superfram
将同步的页面打开过程异步化，来减少用户等待和提供渲染优化的可能。
整体架构中包括低层的
是由一系列技术构成的解决方案，为了最大限度地灵活和通用
来控制具体的页面入场、渲染和退场行为。
点击超链接或浏览器跳转时，异步地获取数据并将内容展现给用户。
采取分层设计，产品方可通过编写

attach和detach必须发生在create之后，destroy之前
attach和detach是互斥的，二者不可并发
attach：该回调发生在切换到一个service时，在上一个service被destroy之后触发。建议进行视图渲染和重绘，事件绑定操作。
create和destroy是互斥的，二者不可并发

detach：该回调发生在当前service将被移出时，在service即将发生切换时立即触发。建议进行当前dom状态的记录（比如滚动位置）。

二者的生命周期回调会以下列顺序执行：
任何一个promise被reject都会导致后续生命周期回调不被执行（错误栈仍然被抛出在控制台中）。
任何一个抛出同步异常都会使得后续函数不会被调用。
其中view的生命周期由service自行调用。本文主要介绍service的生命周期。
典型的情形如：service载入过程中（生命周期回调返回的promise仍然pending的状态），用户触发了浏览器返回。
同一个service的上述声明周期会被多次调用。构造过程需要提供构造函数，析构过程可以防止destroy中（需要做好与退场动画的兼容）。
四者都被顺序执行结束后，dispatch运行完成。
在attach之后再去请求数据（不推荐）
在一个dispatch尚在执行过程中，下一个dispatch仍然可能会被触发。
在创建service实例时，需要继承自ralltiir提供的service基类。
在默认情况下（生命周期函数未实现或实现为空），上述四个函数会被顺序调用。

./.title: 概述
./.body:
概述
Superframe前端极速浏览框架，是一种前端异步单页技术。 
点击超链接或浏览器跳转时，异步地获取数据并将内容展现给用户。
以此来减少用户等待时间，以及提高页面渲染速度。Superframe 主要特性如下：

更快的页面加速
更多的用户到达
更好的浏览体验
低成本的接入方式

异步渲染
Superframe 将同步的页面打开过程异步化，来减少用户等待和提供渲染优化的可能。
整体架构
Superframe 是由一系列技术构成的解决方案，为了最大限度地灵活和通用
Superframe 采取分层设计，产品方可通过编写 Service 来控制具体的页面入场、渲染和退场行为。
Superframe 整体架构中包括低层的 AMD 环境、 Superframe 框架核心。

get-started/1-hello-world.html.title: 1. Hello World

get-started/2-service.html.title: 2. 编写 Service

get-started/3-action.html.title: 3. Action与路由

advanced/debug.html.title: 框架 Debug
advanced/debug.html.body:
框架 Debug
使用开发版的 Ralltiir 可以启用框架核心的调试功能。
在调试模式下，Ralltiir 提供了详细的页面调起和渲染日志。
为了支持移动端调试，可以通过 URL 参数来指定将调试日志实时发送到服务器。
下载安装
需要首先在发布页面选择“development”版本下载后部署在你的环境中。
如果在测试环境中，需要更新测试环境代码中对应的 Ralltiir 源码。
调试日志
在打开容器页（第一个让浏览器访问的 URL） 时，在浏览器控制台就可以看到 Ralltiir 框架日志了。例如：
http://localhost:8080/
移动设备调试
在移动设备调试时，可以将 debug 日志发送到某台服务器，
需要增加debug-server=xxx参数。例如：
http://localhost:8080/path?debug-server=http://example.com

注意debug-server可能需要encodeURIComponent。

advanced/life-cycle.html.title: 生命周期概述

api/action.html.title: Action
api/action.html.body:
action
A Service Management Singleton
Accepts service registration and provides service switch,
which is triggered by the Router

action
.regist(url, service)
.unregist(url)
.dispatch(current, prev) ⇒ Promise
.isIndexPage() ⇒ boolean
.remove(name) ⇒ any
.exist(name) ⇒ boolean
.config(options)
.clear()
.redirect(url, query, options, data)
.back()
.reset(url, query, options, data)
.start(options)
.stop()
.update(url, query, options, data) ⇒ Object




action.regist(url, service)
Register a service instance to action
Kind: static method of action  



Param
Type
Description




url
string | RestFul | RegExp
The path of the service


service
Object
The service object to be registered



Example  
action.regist('/person', new Service());
 action.regist('/person/:id', new Service());
 action.regist(/^person\/\d+/, new Service());


action.unregist(url)
Un-register a service by path
Kind: static method of action  



Param
Type
Description




url
string | RestFul | RegExp
The path of the service




action.dispatch(current, prev) ⇒ Promise
Switch from the previous service to the current one.
 Call prev.detach, prev.destroy,
 current.create, current.attach in serial.
 Typically called by the Router,
 you may not want to call dispatch manually.
 If any of these callbacks returns a Thenable, it'll be await.
 If the promise is rejected, the latter callbacks will NOT be called.
 Returns a promise that
 resolves if all callbacks executed without throw (or reject),
 rejects if any of the callbacks throwed or rejected.
 Note: If current and prev is the same service,
 the prev.destroy will NOT be called.
Kind: static method of action  



Param
Type
Description




current
Object
The current scope


prev
Object
The previous scope




action.isIndexPage() ⇒ boolean
Check if currently in initial page
Kind: static method of actionReturns: boolean - whether current page is the index page
action.remove(name) ⇒ any
Remove a registered service
Kind: static method of actionReturns: any - the return value of Map#delete  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The path of the service

Type
Description

Object
key/value pairs to config the action

Object

boolean
Optional, 是否静默跳转（不改变URL）

api/cache.html.title: Cache
api/cache.html.body:
Cache
cache.js A simple LRU cache implementation.
Performance Notes: Since LRU queue is implemented by JavaScript Array internally,
it's enough for small cache limits.
Large cache limits may require linklist implementation.
Author: harttleyangjun14@baidu.com  

Cache
.create(name, options) ⇒ Namespace
.using(name) ⇒ Object
.set(name, key, value) ⇒ any
.get(name, key) ⇒ any
.rename(name, before, after) ⇒ any
.remove(name, key) ⇒ any
.clear(name) ⇒ undefined | Namespace
.contains(name, key) ⇒ boolean




Cache.create(name, options) ⇒ Namespace
Create a namespaced cache instance
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: Namespace - the namespace object created  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace identifier


options
Object
The options object used to create the namespace




Cache.using(name) ⇒ Object
Using a specific namespace
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: Object - The scoped cache object  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace identifier




Cache.set(name, key, value) ⇒ any
Set a cache item
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: any - The return value of corresponding Namespace#set  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace for your cache item


key
string
The key for your cache item


value
any
The value for your cache item




Cache.get(name, key) ⇒ any
Get a cache item
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: any - The value for your cache item, or undefined if the specified item does not exist.  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace for your cache item


key
string
The key for your cache item




Cache.rename(name, before, after) ⇒ any
Rename a cache item
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: any - The return value of corresponding Namespace#rename  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace for your cache item


before
string
The source key for your cache item


after
string
The destination key for your cache item




Cache.remove(name, key) ⇒ any
Remove a specific key in namespace name
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: any - The return value of corresponding Namespace#remove  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace identifier


key
string
The key to remove




Cache.clear(name) ⇒ undefined | Namespace
Clear the given namespace, or all namespaces if name not set.
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: undefined | Namespace - Return the Namespace object if name is given, undefined otherwise.  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The namespace to clear.




Cache.contains(name, key) ⇒ boolean
Check whether the given key exists within the namespace, or whether the namespace exists if key not set.
Kind: static method of CacheReturns: boolean - Return if the namespace specified by name contains key  



Param
Type
Description

string
The namespace to check


key
string
The key to check with

api/emitter.html.title: Emitter
api/emitter.html.body:
Emitter
emitter
Author: Firede(firede@firede.us)Example  
var emitter = new Emitter();
emitter.on('foo', function(value) {
    console.log(value);
 });
 // console.log: 'test'
 emitter.emit('foo', 'test');


Emitter
Emitter ⏏
new Emitter()
.mixin(obj) ⇒ Object






Emitter ⏏
Kind: Exported class

Create a emitter instance

api/http.html.title: Http
api/http.html.body:
http
http http utility
Author: harttleyangjun14@baidu.com  

http
.ajax(url, settings) ⇒ Promise
.get(url, data) ⇒ Promise
.post(url, data) ⇒ Promise
.put(url, data) ⇒ Promise
.delete(url, data) ⇒ Promise




http.ajax(url, settings) ⇒ Promise
Perform an asynchronous HTTP (Ajax) request.
Kind: static method of httpReturns: Promise - A promise resolves/rejects with the xhr  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.


settings
Object
A set of key/value pairs that configure the Ajax request. All settings are optional.


settings.method
string
The method to open the Ajax request.


settings.data
any
The data to send, could be a string, a FormData, or a plain object. The 'Content-type' header is guessed accordingly, ie. 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded', 'multipart/form-data'.


settings.headers
Object
A set of key/value pairs that configure the Ajax request headers. If set to 'application/json', the settings.data will be JSON.stringified; If set to 'x-www-form-urlencoded', which is by default, the settings.data will be url-encoded.


settings.jsonp
boolean
[NOT implemented yet] Whether or not to use JSONP, default to false.


settings.jsonpCallback
string
[NOT implemented yet] Specify the callback function name for a JSONP request. This value will be used instead of the random name automatically generated by default.


settings.xhrFields
xhrFields
A set of key/value pairs that configure the fields of the xhr object. Note: onreadystatechange not supported, make use of the returned promise instead.



Example  
ajax('/foo', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
            "content-type": "application/json"
        },
        xhrFields: {
            withCredentials: true
        }
    })
    .then(function(xhr) {
        xhr.status == 200;
        xhr.responseHeaders['Content-Type'] == 'application/json';
        xhr.responseText == '{"foo": "bar"}';
        // xhr.data is parsed from responseText according to Content-Type
        xhr.data === {foo: 'bar'};
    });
    .catch(function(xhr|errorThrown ) {});
    .finally(function(xhr|errorThrown ) { });


http.get(url, data) ⇒ Promise
Load data from the server using a HTTP GET request.
Kind: static method of httpReturns: Promise - A promise resolves/rejects with the xhr  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.


data
Object
A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.




http.post(url, data) ⇒ Promise
Load data from the server using a HTTP POST request.
Kind: static method of httpReturns: Promise - A promise resolves/rejects with the xhr  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.


data
Object
A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.




http.put(url, data) ⇒ Promise
Load data from the server using a HTTP PUT request.
Kind: static method of httpReturns: Promise - A promise resolves/rejects with the xhr  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.


data
Object
A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.




http.delete(url, data) ⇒ Promise
Load data from the server using a HTTP DELETE request.
Kind: static method of httpReturns: Promise - A promise resolves/rejects with the xhr  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.


data
Object
A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.

api/promise.html.title: Promise
api/promise.html.body:
Promise
promise.js A Promise Implementation
This implementation conforms to Promise/A+ spec. see: https://promisesaplus.com/
Author: harttle yangjun14@baidu.com  

Promise
Promise ⏏
new Promise(cb)
instance
._doResolve(fn)
._done(onFulfilled, onRejected) ⇒ undefined
.then(onFulfilled, onRejected) ⇒ Promise
.catch(cb) ⇒ Promise
.finally(cb) ⇒ Promise


static
.resolve(obj) ⇒ Promise
.reject(err) ⇒ Promise
.all(promises) ⇒ Promise
.fromCallback(resolver) ⇒ Promise
.mapSeries(iterable, iteratee) ⇒ Promise








Promise ⏏
Kind: Exported class
new Promise(cb)
Create a new promise.
The passed in function will receive functions resolve and reject as its arguments
which can be called to seal the fate of the created promise.
The returned promise will be resolved when resolve is called, and rejected when reject called or any exception occurred.
If you pass a promise object to the resolve function, the created promise will follow the state of that promise.



Param
Type
Description




cb
function
The resolver callback.



Example  
var p = new Promise(function(resolve, reject){
    true ? resolve('foo') : reject('bar');
});


promise._doResolve(fn)
Resolve the un-trusted promise definition function: fn
which has exactly the same signature as the .then function
Kind: instance method of Promise  



Param
Type
Description




fn
function
the reslver




promise._done(onFulfilled, onRejected) ⇒ undefined
Register a callback on fulfilled or rejected.
Kind: instance method of Promise  



Param
Type
Description




onFulfilled
function
the callback on fulfilled


onRejected
function
the callback on rejected




promise.then(onFulfilled, onRejected) ⇒ Promise
The Promise/A+ .then, register a callback on resolve. See: https://promisesaplus.com/
Kind: instance method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable.  



Param
Type
Description




onFulfilled
function
The fulfilled callback.


onRejected
function
The rejected callback.




promise.catch(cb) ⇒ Promise
The Promise/A+ .catch, retister a callback on reject. See: https://promisesaplus.com/
Kind: instance method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable.  



Param
Type
Description




cb
function
The callback to be registered.




promise.finally(cb) ⇒ Promise
Register a callback on either resolve or reject. See: https://promisesaplus.com/
Kind: instance method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable.  



Param
Type
Description




cb
function
The callback to be registered.




Promise.resolve(obj) ⇒ Promise
Create a promise that is resolved with the given value.
If value is already a thenable, it is returned as is.
If value is not a thenable, a fulfilled Promise is returned with value as its fulfillment value.
Kind: static method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable which resolves the given obj  



Param
Type
Description




obj
Promise | any
The value to be resolved.




Promise.reject(err) ⇒ Promise
Create a promise that is rejected with the given error.
Kind: static method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable which is rejected with the given error  



Param
Type
Description




err
Error
The error to reject with.




Promise.all(promises) ⇒ Promise
This method is useful for when you want to wait for more than one promise to complete.
Given an Iterable(arrays are Iterable), or a promise of an Iterable,
which produces promises (or a mix of promises and values),
iterate over all the values in the Iterable into an array and return a promise that is fulfilled when
all the items in the array are fulfilled.
The promise's fulfillment value is an array with fulfillment values at respective positions to the original array.
If any promise in the array rejects, the returned promise is rejected with the rejection reason.
Kind: static method of PromiseReturns: Promise - A thenable.  



Param
Type
Description




promises
Iterable. | Promise.>
The promises to wait for.




Promise.fromCallback(resolver) ⇒ Promise
Promisify callback
Kind: static method of PromiseReturns: Promise - that is resolved by a node style callback function. This is the most fitting way to do on the fly promisification when libraries don't expose classes for automatic promisification.  



Param
Type
Description




resolver
function
The callback to promisify




Promise.mapSeries(iterable, iteratee) ⇒ Promise
Call functions in serial until someone rejected.
Kind: static method of PromiseReturns: Promise - the promise resolves when the last is completed  



Param
Type
Description




iterable
Array
the array to iterate with.


iteratee
Array
returns a new promise. The iteratee is invoked with three arguments: (value, index, iterable).

api/resource.html.title: Resource

resource
resource.js REST resource CRUD utility
Author: harttleyangjun14@baidu.com  

resource

Create an Object from obj with the given options.

and rejects whenever there is an error.

options

Query Objects with the given options.
Kind: instance method of ResourceReturns: Promise - A promise resolves when retrieved successful,
and rejects whenever there is an error.

options

resource.update(obj, options) ⇒ Promise
Update the object specified by obj with the given options.

and rejects whenever there is an error.  



Param

Description




obj
Object

resource.delete(options) ⇒ Promise
Delete objects with the given options.
Kind: instance method of ResourceReturns: Promise - A promise resolves when obj is deleted successful, and rejects whenever there is an error.

options

A set of key/value pairs to configure the URL query.

api/router.html.title: Router
api/router.html.body:
Router
Router Frontend router via popstate and pushstate.
Author: treelitec.xinle@gmail.com, Firedefirede@firede.us  

Router
router ⏏
.pathPattern(url) ⇒ Object
.reset(url, query, options)
.config(options)
.add(path, fn, thisArg)
.remove(path)
.exist(path) ⇒ boolean
.clear()
.redirect(url, query, options)
.start(options)
.stop()
.controller(implement)
.getState() ⇒ Object






router ⏏
Kind: Exported class
router.pathPattern(url) ⇒ Object
Find registered path pattern by url
Kind: static method of routerReturns: Object - The handler object associated with the given url  



Param
Type
Description




url
string
The url string




router.reset(url, query, options)

url

router.clear()

router.redirect(url, query, options)

api/service.html.title: Service

api/underscore.html.title: Underscore
api/underscore.html.body:
underscore : object
A lightweight underscore implementation.
包括字符串工具、对象工具、函数工具、语言增强等。设计原则：

与 Lodash 重合的功能与其保持接口一致，
 文档: https://github.com/exports/exports
Lodash 中不包含的部分，如有需要可联系 yangjvn14 (Hi)
 文档：本文件中函数注释。

Kind: global namespace  

underscore : object
.keysIn(object) ⇒ Array
.forOwn(object, iteratee) ⇒ Object
.toArray(value) ⇒ Array
.forEach(collection, iteratee) ⇒ undefined
.map(collection, iteratee) ⇒ Array
.slice(collection, start, end) ⇒ Array
.splice(collection) ⇒ Array
.split(str) ⇒ Array
.findIndex(array, [predicate], [fromIndex]) ⇒ number
.format(fmt) ⇒ string
.defaults(object, ...sources) ⇒ Object
.isObject(value) ⇒ boolean
.isString(value) ⇒ boolean
.contains(list, value, fromIndex) ⇒ number
.isRegExp(value) ⇒ boolean
.assign(object, ...source) ⇒ Object
.defaultsDeep(object, ...sources) ⇒ Object
.fromPairs(pairs) ⇒ Object
.isArray(value) ⇒ boolean
.isEmpty(value) ⇒ boolean
.negate(predicate) ⇒ function
.partial(func, ...partials) ⇒ function
.partialRight(func, ...partials) ⇒ function
.wrap(value, wrapper) ⇒ function
.inherits(subClass, superClass) ⇒ function




underscore.keysIn(object) ⇒ Array
Creates an array of the own and inherited enumerable property names of object.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - Returns the array of property names.  



Param
Type
Description




object
Object
The object to query.




underscore.forOwn(object, iteratee) ⇒ Object
Iterates over own enumerable string keyed properties of an object and invokes iteratee for each property.
The iteratee is invoked with three arguments: (value, key, object).
Iteratee functions may exit iteration early by explicitly returning false.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Object - Returs object.  



Param
Type
Description




object
Object
The object to iterate over.


iteratee
function
The function invoked per iteration.




underscore.toArray(value) ⇒ Array
Converts value to an array.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - Returns the converted array.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to convert.




underscore.forEach(collection, iteratee) ⇒ undefined
Iterates over elements of collection and invokes iteratee for each element.
The iteratee is invoked with three arguments: (value, index|key, collection).
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: undefined - Just like Array.prototype.forEach  



Param
Type
Description




collection
Array | Object
The collection to iterate over.


iteratee
function
The function invoked per iteration.




underscore.map(collection, iteratee) ⇒ Array
Creates an array of values by running each element in collection thru iteratee.
The iteratee is invoked with three arguments: (value, index|key, collection).
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - Returns the new mapped array.  



Param
Type
Description




collection
Array | Object
The collection to iterate over.


iteratee
function
The function invoked per iteration.




underscore.slice(collection, start, end) ⇒ Array
Creates a slice of array from start up to, but not including, end.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - Returns the slice of array.  



Param
Type
Description




collection
Array
The array to slice.


start
number
The start position.


end
number
The end position.




underscore.splice(collection) ⇒ Array
This method is based on JavaScript Array.prototype.splice
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - the spliced result  



Param
Type
Description




collection
Collection
the collection to be spliced




underscore.split(str) ⇒ Array
This method is based on JavaScript String.prototype.split
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Array - Returns the string segments.  



Param
Type
Description




str
string
the string to be splited.




underscore.findIndex(array, [predicate], [fromIndex]) ⇒ number
Find and return the index of the first element predicate returns truthy for instead of the element itself.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: number - Returns the index of the found element, else -1.  



Param
Type
Default
Description




array
Array

The array to inspect.


[predicate]
function
_.identity
The function invoked per iteration.


[fromIndex]
number
0
The index to search from.




underscore.format(fmt) ⇒ string
The missing string formatting function for JavaScript.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: string - The result string.  



Param
Type
Description




fmt
string
The format string (can only contain "%s")



Example  
format("foo%sfoo", "bar");   // returns "foobarfoo"


underscore.defaults(object, ...sources) ⇒ Object
Assigns own and inherited enumerable string keyed properties of source objects to
the destination object for all destination properties that resolve to undefined.
Source objects are applied from left to right.
Once a property is set, additional values of the same property are ignored.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Object - Returns object.  



Param
Type
Description




object
Object
The destination object.


...sources
Object
The source objects.




underscore.isObject(value) ⇒ boolean
Checks if value is the language type of Object.
(e.g. arrays, functions, objects, regexes, new Number(0), and new String(''))
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: boolean - Returns true if value is an object, else false.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to check.




underscore.isString(value) ⇒ boolean
Checks if value is classified as a String primitive or object.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: boolean - Returns true if value is a string, else false.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to check.




underscore.contains(list, value, fromIndex) ⇒ number
Uses indexOf internally, if list is an Array. Use fromIndex to start your search at a given index.
http://underscorejs.org/#contains
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: number - Returns true if the value is present in the list, false otherwise.  



Param
Type
Description




list
Array | string
the list of items in which to find


value
any
the value to find


fromIndex
number
Optional, default to 0




underscore.isRegExp(value) ⇒ boolean
Checks if value is classified as a RegExp object.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: boolean - Returns true if value is a RegExp, else false.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to check.




underscore.assign(object, ...source) ⇒ Object
Assigns own enumerable string keyed properties of source objects to the destination object.
Source objects are applied from left to right.
Subsequent sources overwrite property assignments of previous sources.
Note: This method mutates object and is loosely based on Object.assign.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Object - Returns object.  



Param
Type
Description




object
Object
The destination object.


...source
Object
The source objects.




underscore.defaultsDeep(object, ...sources) ⇒ Object
This method is like _.defaults except that it recursively assigns default properties.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Object - Returns object.  



Param
Type
Description




object
Object
The destination object.


...sources
Object
The source objects.




underscore.fromPairs(pairs) ⇒ Object
The inverse of _.toPairs; this method returns an object composed from key-value pairs.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: Object - Returns the new object.  



Param
Type
Description




pairs
Array
The key-value pairs.




underscore.isArray(value) ⇒ boolean
Checks if value is classified as an Array object.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: boolean - Returns true if value is an array, else false.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to check.




underscore.isEmpty(value) ⇒ boolean
Checks if value is an empty object, collection, map, or set.
Objects are considered empty if they have no own enumerable string keyed properties.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: boolean - Returns true if value is an array, else false.  



Param
Type
Description




value
any
The value to check.




underscore.negate(predicate) ⇒ function
Creates a function that negates the result of the predicate func.
The func predicate is invoked with the this binding and arguments of the created function.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: function - Returns the new negated function.  



Param
Type
Description




predicate
function
The predicate to negate.




underscore.partial(func, ...partials) ⇒ function
Creates a function that invokes func with partials prepended to the arguments it receives.
This method is like _.bind except it does not alter the this binding.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: function - Returns the new partially applied function.  



Param
Type
Description




func
function
The function to partially apply arguments to.


...partials
any
The arguments to be partially applied.




underscore.partialRight(func, ...partials) ⇒ function
This method is like _.partial except that partially applied arguments are appended to the arguments it receives.
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: function - Returns the new partially applied function.  



Param
Type
Description




func
function
The function to partially apply arguments to.


...partials
any
The arguments to be partially applied.




underscore.wrap(value, wrapper) ⇒ function
Creates a function that provides value to wrapper as its first argument.
Any additional arguments provided to the function are appended to those provided to the wrapper. The wrapper is invoked with the this binding of the created function.\
Kind: static method of underscoreReturns: function - Returns the new function.  



Param
Type
Description




value
*
The value to wrap.


wrapper
function
The wrapper function.




underscore.inherits(subClass, superClass) ⇒ function
为类型构造器建立继承关系
Kind: static method of underscore  



Param
Type
Description




subClass
function
子类构造器


superClass
function
父类构造器

api/url.html.title: Url
api/url.html.body:
url
URL url parse utility
Author: treelite(c.xinle@gmail.com)  

url
url ⏏
new url(data)
.parse(str) ⇒ Object
.resolve(from, [to]) ⇒ string
.param(obj) ⇒ string






url ⏏
Kind: Exported class
new url(data)
创建URI对象



Param
Type
Description




data
string | Object
uri




url.parse(str) ⇒ Object
解析URI字符串
Kind: static method of urlReturns: Object - The URL Object  



Param
Type
Description




str
string
URI字符串




url.resolve(from, [to]) ⇒ string
resolve path
Kind: static method of url  



Param
Type
Description




from
string
起始路径


[to]
string
目标路径




url.param(obj) ⇒ string
Format a plain object into query string.
Kind: static method of urlReturns: string - The result query string.  



Param
Type
Description




obj
Object
The object to be formated.



Example  
param({foo:'bar ', bar: 'foo'});     // yields "foo=bar%20&bar=foo"

api/view.html.title: View
api/view.html.body:
view
view.js View prototype for service implementations
Author: harttle yangjun14@baidu.com  

view
View ⏏
new View()
.set()
.get()
.create()
.render()
.update()
.attach()
.detach()
.destroy()
.on(name, callback)
.off(name)






View ⏏
Kind: Exported class
new View()
Create a new view instance

view.set()
Initialize properties
Kind: instance method of View
view.get()
Get properties
Kind: instance method of View
view.create()
Called when view created
Kind: instance method of View
view.render()
Render the DOM, called when render requested. Override this to render your HTML
Kind: instance method of View
view.update()
Update the view, called when update requested. Override this to update or re-render your HTML.
Kind: instance method of View
view.attach()
Callback when view attached to DOM
Kind: instance method of View
view.detach()
Callback when view detached from DOM
Kind: instance method of View
view.destroy()
Destroy the view, called when destroy requested.
Kind: instance method of View
view.on(name, callback)
Bind an event to the view.
Kind: instance method of View  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The name of the event


callback
function
The callback when the event triggered




view.off(name)
Unbind the given event
Kind: instance method of View  



Param
Type
Description




name
string
The event name to unbind
